website_summaries.verdict: Consumers rave about durability and flexibility, but its ability to live up to the rated mount capacity is questionable.
pros: Multi-directional positioning is easy to use
cons: Though rated to hold TVs up to 115 pounds, it tends to tilt forward with heavier TVs
Screws are too short for some TVs

customer_reviews.title: Tilts forward on 65' TV
customer_reviews.text: We installed this mount with a 65 inch Vizio and no matter what it tilted forward. We fixed by inserting a pencil between the tv and the bottom of the bracket on each side.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Sara Flint

customer_reviews.title: Great mount so far.
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. They instruction mention placing the tv brackets so the adjustment screws will be outward on each side. Both of mine are on the left, so one is accessible and the other isn't. Not a bid deal since i adjusted prior to hanging on wall mount. Kit could also include the optional pin and do away with the laughable "level", or tiny flash light included. I can't speak to the HDMI cable that's included other than to saying seems like a low grade quality compared to other brands I'm already hooked up with. Overall the mount is a great buy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some people love 'em, but....
customer_reviews.text: ...I'm not one of those people. Unboxed the unit to find that it's missing two components (piece "M Side Vertical Bracket") rendering it unusable and frankly, I lack confidence in the design (for my purposes) to exchange it back... my 2¢ is that this is a light-duty mount, probably just fine for lightweight 32"-and-under sets but I don't care to fly my 42" Samsung off of it. 16" stud spacing only if you want to use two studs. Updated with correction: 100% my mistake about the "missing" brackets; they were misplaced here when the box was opened and I didn't catch it until later. No fault of the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: E J Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, secure and simple
customer_reviews.text: This may be one of the best bargains you can get when it comes to television accessories. This TV mount is very solid, strong and it’s quite simple to install. Some people have mentioned the tilt is too much. Take note of the instruction manual where you are able to insert a pin into the bracket in order to keep the television more upright. They say the pin is optional but I just ended up using one of the smaller screws that was originally intended to be used to mount the brackets to the back of the television. The included HDMI cable the level and the small flashlight is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Dave the rave

customer_reviews.title: Don’t attempt to buy
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough bad things about this tv mount. I have bought plenty throughout the years and this is by far the worst ever! Do not buy unless you have a TV smaller than 32”. It states it can accommodate an 80”. No way! As soon as I put the 75” on the mount I took it off out of fear it would collapse! How can you sell a product for up to an 80” without having a solid piece for the wall mount? It wasn’t the least expensive so I trusted it would do well. The reviews gave it glowing marks. Do Not Buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dean M. Gerstein

customer_reviews.title: A "decent" mount that has an engineered bias to one side or the other, by design.
customer_reviews.text: Like I said a good enough mount, that supports my 70'' Toshiba, yet it has a bias to the right by merit of the way the "arms" are designed to collapse. yes I ensure it was leveled correctly ( 3 times ) yes I am sure the Unit was mounted to the TV correctly (3 times); yet when extended and or collapsed it will "lean" to the right by several degrees. Its in the play room so not to much of a hassle. Yet if you want your set up to look good and not bothered by the occasionally "is that thing leaning" query. Your going to be fine with this thing at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just put this together
customer_reviews.text: Just put this together The overall strength seems way adequate and comes with all kinds of different screws to adapt to many brands and sizes. 4Stars deserves 5 except for instructions and lack of a engineered squaring system while bolting together. Not a big deal in my book just a cautionary approach will do well Pros: Price! and component fitment. Neat accessories. Cons: The instructions are iffy at best. Pay attention to the "pictures" Its not difficult just not an ABC instruction sheet. When assembling for a large tv use a straight edge while tightening all the screw to keep the mount square. Could ness You up if you don't check it. I will recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Just a little

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want!
customer_reviews.text: I believe that I have purchased this wall mount at least eight times. I have two myself and I have bought them as gifts for friends and family because these are incredibly good quality and very bargain priced. I have used this to mount televisions from 32" up to 75", and while it's rated for up to 80" I'm not sure why this product would be limited to that as the materials of construction are particularly robust. The spring-lock latches with the release cords are a really nice touch and they make taking the TV off the mount (for whatever your reason is) very easy to accomplish. I expect that I will be buying this one again-and-again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Holzer

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product, bends near extension
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing product. Wall bracket was bent right out of box. I had to use the extension because my studs are 24 inches apart. When I hung the tv frame sags near extension. It's holding firm, but inferior product. The instructions are poor concerning installing extension. You get a 10 foot HDMI cable, and plastic bevel for leveling. That's a deal. And supposedly it will tilt. But you may need spacers, which they provide. For the price you get a lot. But if you have studs 24 inches apart I can't recommend this product. I mean, it's working, but the sag at the extension is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Arty B

customer_reviews.title: Terrific HD Omni-directional Mount!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and we've had it up for over a year with ZERO problems! Holding up a 65" TV. Instructions are easy to read and unlike so many other products "made overseas" these made sense and were clear & precise. NOTE: Unless you are super handy with Power Tools, meaning really Skilled like a Carpenter; and you maybe have a collection of 18-20 Volt cordless power tools; do yourself a favor... hire a qualified Handyman to install it, and do it right! You sure don't want a $750+New TV falling off the wall!
customer_reviews.author: THX1138

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install, Solidly Made
customer_reviews.text: This took me with my leveler and own power drill only 10 minutes to install by myself! I have seen other mounts before be hard to set up with too many working pieces, with the pop in at the top and bottom of the mounts it should be no trouble to install by yourself. The hardest part is figuring out how to use the extension piece and which washers to use based on your tv. The other slight pain but it is easily fixed is that the two pull down strings to release the mount when you want to remove tv can hang beneath the tv, I found taping them to the back works fine.
customer_reviews.author: BlakeCoats

customer_reviews.title: Tv tilts forward with no way to adjust.
customer_reviews.text: I should have read more reviews. I experienced what many have where the tv will just hang forward without anyway to get it flat. Easy to install and looked solid but look at this picture and you see you can only watch it from the floor😡 I went from one star to five star because they sent a replacement that worked fine. Great customer service. If it does not work to your liking let them know and they will take care of you!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, not much of a tilt
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this because the previous home owners left the wall mount piece of the same brand. It was very easy to install since the wall piece was already mounted. We did use the provided screws - only disappointment was that the tilt is only 15 degrees - which is advertised, but I guess it seems less once it was already mounted. Also, if you have electrical that is flush to the wall, it gets very tight, so the best would be a recessed electrical outlet. Otherwise easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and decent
customer_reviews.text: Mount is cheap and does a decent job. I would suggest doing the following if you buy this to make it a lot better: -Buy a 3/8" lock washer and flat washer (flat washer can be up to 1 1/2" wide. Use these on the bolts that hold the mount into the wall. Otherwise I've found that the bolts will back out over time and the washers they provide are very thin and flimsy. I did get a hold of the company and they plan to make improvements in the future. Otherwise, there needs to be some way of locking the preferred angle of the TV once it's installed. Fix those two things and you have a five-star TV mount.
customer_reviews.author: M. Erdman

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my dad who is disabled and in a wheelchair. He had an old big screen box television and my siblings and I upgraded him to a new HD flat panel smartTV. Bought this mount so he can watch tv from the awkward angle he has to sit which is off to the side and not directly infront of the wall. The mount worked fine for a while, but 6 months later is starting to tilt downward. It appears that the mount, which looked strong it pretty weak as the arms bend over time.
customer_reviews.author: Jrod The Gr8

customer_reviews.title: Best mount for the money, period.
customer_reviews.text: I found Cheetah mounts through Amazon 6 or 7 years ago after trying out numerous other wall mounts. No lie, I have wall mounted close to 30 televisions between my houses and family members, I will only use Cheetah mounts. The price to quality is completely unparalleled not to mention the hardware that comes with it, lag bolts and tons of additional screws, washers and spacers make these a no brainier. They even throw in a nice braided HDMI cable. I highly recommend these mounts.
customer_reviews.author: Captainflapjax

customer_reviews.title: TV bracket at max degree, bottom pin will NOT lock - FIX
customer_reviews.text: Issue I’ve found with the cheetah wall mount. When tv bracket is adjusted to max degree, the bottom pin will not lock as I have shown in my attached photo. Quite frustrating when the stock photo of the product on this page even proves this (deduct that from me not reviewing the pictures more prior to my purchase). Fix is to add a small washer between the wall and wall bracket when installing each wall anchor. NOTE: make sure you still have the applicable amount of anchor needed in wall/stud when applying this fix
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, the supplied lag bolts  are too short for Thick Plaster walls
customer_reviews.text: A well made articulated mount, but there is only 4-1/2 inches from the top to bottom mounting rail, and only accommodates wall stud spacing up to 16". So there is tremendous pull force on the upper 2 lag bolts. Instruction state it's critical to pre-drill holes at the exact center of wood studs or used supplied plastic anchors to masonry wall. I would not trust the plastic anchors. The bolts not long enough to penetrate studs if the drywall/plaster/lath is more than 1/2" thick. Also, has to request special hardware because the kit only included short 6mm screws. Otherwise a great mount
customer_reviews.author: hap

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: We had this for about 2 months now. Got a new 75” tv and needed a bigger mount. This was great. Took my husband about 40 min to put it up on the wall mostly because of how big the tv was. It is really sturdy, makes me feel comfortable having the kids playing on the floor under it. We have also had a couple mild earthquakes and it hasn’t moved. Also nice how affordable it was. The cable and leveler where definitely a bonus. Definitely recommend it. If this review was helpful please like it below. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: The Williams

customer_reviews.title: The best TV/Monitor mount money can buy
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these, one holding a 32 inch monitor, a second holing a 30 inch monitor another holding a 42 inch TV and the 4 th holding a 55 inch HDTV over my fireplace. As you might guess I am fond of these critters. If you lag bolt them into studs you could hang an old Buick on one and tilt or swivel. Don't buy the cheap crap, get one of these. They come with every nut, bolt, screw and washer you could possibly need including the lag screws to mount to the wall. Instructions are fairly passable, and you can get more online. Do it!
customer_reviews.author: Charles R.

customer_reviews.title: and it worked great. Installation was dirt simple
customer_reviews.text: Solid, stable, well built arm. I used this on a small 32-inch TV, and it worked great. Installation was dirt simple, aside from having to find longer bolts. The cheezy level they provided with it will make a great gift for an unsuspecting relative at some point in the future. *Update* - On an earlier version of this review, I pointed out the issue with not having the right screws for my TV. It seems that the issue of longer screws can be addressed by requesting them by the seller. That may have been there when I bought this, so it's probably not fair for me to complain about the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Well built, possible mounting issue
customer_reviews.text: The vertical pieces that attach to the TV might stick up over the top of smaller TVs. I have a Samsung 40" unit and, due to the design of the TV, the mounting braces stick up over the top. Other than that, the unit is well built and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mount 5 years ago. When tilting to the side the left side would sag. No adjustments corrected this issue. With the purchase of a 65 inch TV the sag was worse. Looked into a new mount. Came across the same unit for $20 less. Read the reviews and found someone else had the same sagging issue. Customer service determined that the unit was defective and replaced it. Issue solved. So I contacted customer support and they without hesitation sent me a new mount. TV does not sag. Awesome range of motion. Not many companies would stand by and replace their product 5 yrs later. Good Job and Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Bob J.

customer_reviews.title: First non fixed mount. Let’s see how it performs compared to outlet cheetah products I own.
customer_reviews.text: I have used two of their fix mounted products with great success. I used this on a 43” lg that weighs18lbs. The mount does not even know that a tv is on the end. The unit is exactly 16” spacing for studs. Keep this in mind when mounting your tv on the wall due to studs typically do not line up in the center of the wall like you would want. I had about 3” of play off center due to the way my brackets mounted to the back of my tv making my application work perfect. Good product. Great price. Can’t complain. Will be getting a fourth in the near future for a bedroom tv.
customer_reviews.author: TOA

customer_reviews.title: Strong hold.
customer_reviews.text: Light and slim design, but very durable for mounting heavy TVs. It holds my 100 lb tv pretty well. I drilled the 4 already provided screws into my studs as well as used some drywall anchors from Lowe’s with the extra holes already on the bracket for premium security. Only downfall is, the bracket is very slim and once you hook up the tv it’s difficult to screw or make any adjustment if you need to reach behind the tv to install some cables or tighten any screws because the space gap between the tv and wall is a very tight squeeze. Other than that, it’s a pretty decent tv mount for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Khoi Tran

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, 65” tv sags
customer_reviews.text: Sags with a 65” TV. Not nearly 115lbs of weight and it sags when extended. The bolts that allow rotation to level the tv are not strong enough to keep the TV straight when pulling from the wall. The tilt bolts have the same problem. I will be replacing this tv mount with one truly meant for a 65” tv, I wouldn’t use this for anything larger than 40” and that still may be pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: moto4sho

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3 of them so far!
customer_reviews.text: TV mounts have come a long way within the past 15 years. Something like this would have cost hundreds of dollars before. Honestly, there's not much to this. You mount it, it works, and you can rotate the TV back and forth. It will rotate up and down as well, but not as easily. If you have multiple TVs, I highly recommend just buying a bunch of the same mount. You can easily swap the TVs out by using the same compatible bracket. Once you find studs, it can take only a few minutes to install the mount. The included level helps out a lot, and the HDMI cable is actually pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: K. W. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Works, but may not be the best fit for you.
customer_reviews.text: Update 10-15-19. Cheetah/SPN has reached out and sent a replacement larger mount. This was not asked for and they sent it out on their own accord, and also issued a partial refund. New mount seems nice, but not needed as I reused an old mount that I had previously. Moving to 4 stars for customer service aspect. Definitely works, and the articulation is nice, but the bracket that attaches to the wall is only 17" wide, so enough to get you from stud to stud, but that may not fit with where you want to mount the tv. Ended up just reusing an old mount I had that allowed for a better placement of the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Jon I Dunham

customer_reviews.title: for the price it works and works well.
customer_reviews.text: The item came well packaged and the directions were easy to understand with good illustrations. overall quality for the item for the price is outstanding. Installation was easy just need a good wall stud finder, phillips screwdriver, 3/16" drill bit, drill, impact driver and sockets for the lag screws. The included hardware was used except the plastic anchors. Don't trust the plastic anchors to secure a 50" tv securely to the wall. The design of the wall mount is a little different then others I've used but seems to securely hold a 50" tv and the arm seems to move smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: bambooligan

customer_reviews.title: Don't use included anchors in drywall
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy. I've got my 65 inch TV hung and it handles like a champ. During install if you can't reach 2 studs in your wall do not use the included wall anchors. Use toggle bolts that you can get from home Depot or Lowe's or whatever hardware store is close to you for a few dollars. The cheap included anchors will slip out over time especially if you move the TV a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good simple design for a TV mount. It has strong lag bolts to put into your studs and the metal frame is solid and stiff. I hung my 55" tv with this mount and it works great for me. There is just enough room for me to reach around the back to adjust the tilt tightening screw, which is easy to adjust if needed. The quick release ropes do hang below my tv, but I stuck them back up with a magnet. Also having a highspeed HDMI cable include is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Only issue is the bad tilt design.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted a tcl 65” to this mount for one year. I’m replacing the tv because the screen got shattered. After a year the over all quality is nice and sturdy besides one part. The mount tilt adjustment (in the photo) that attaches to the back of the tv is not a sturdy design. After a year of use the tilt adjustment/lock Bracket has bent. This doesn’t hold the weight of the tv only the weight from the tilt. This just means that over time this mount will slowly tilt your tv forward. My tv is within the limits. This is a little disappointing besides this issue I would give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: zack alexander

customer_reviews.title: Measure studs first!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Cheetah TV mount, and I’m just as pleased with it as all the others. The only tiny inconvenience is that both of the tightening screws are oriented in the same direction, which means one of them is behind the mounting framework after you’ve mounted the TV. A short screwdriver can reach it, but it’s a little tricky. Ultimately, not enough to knock off a star. Phenomenal product. Be warned: measure your studs first. If they’re not exactly 16” on center or less, get the 24” model, not this one. The product works great, but it is specific to that size limitation.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: New design is terrible, do not be fooled by the reviews--that was for the old design.
customer_reviews.text: Company revised the design of the mount, cutting costs at every corner. No longer uses two hanging points per mount, the latch no longer stays unlatched when going to remove from wall, the wall mount itself has so many high and low points from where it was punched, the joint is no longer centered so centering is more of an issue, every bolt hole has a small lip around it rather than having padding so it's difficult to get a decent sized washer in. DO NOT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Travis W.

customer_reviews.title: Okay tv mount.
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 TVs and have tried different wall mounts for them to see which I like best. This tv mount is okay. For a few extra dollars I would go with the PERLESMITH. Much better quality and greater ability to adjust where the tv is positioned. If your studs are not centered where you are mounting, then you will have some work to do to get the tv centered. I ended up using this mount in the garage for my workout tv. Updated my review because of their customer service regarding my initial review.
customer_reviews.author: Vinicio Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Dont reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this for my 65 inch tv because my original mount doesnt tilt or have any range of motion, with that being said, this product is horrible. It took alot of adding things with a few stops at lowes because this thing isnt built to hold my tv size (as it claims) honestly.it isnt built to hold ANYTHING in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Lauraine Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Second time, it's ok, but price is fair
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit I've bought from this vendor. I forgot how close to the wall this unit is and the 24" barely makes it to the middle of the stud,I wish there were a little more metal that would extend 1" out either side but it does the job. I didn't use the provided anchor screws, I went and got my own self tapping lag screws from Lowe's. Overall for the price it's ok. I wish it works extend outward by another inch. Being pressed up against the wall makes it difficult to get the power cord, cable and HDMI in.
customer_reviews.author: Elias yah

customer_reviews.title: Attaching hardware inadequate - UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Changed this review to 5 stars because of really outstanding customer care. Company contacted me and made things right. This is a good company that reads Amazona reviews and does the right thing for customers. The mount works perfectly. I have a Samsung 65 UHDTV and the mounting hardware sent to attach the bracket to the TV was inadequate. 4 bolts attach bracket to the versa 400 holes. The bottom bolts supplied by Cheetah were not long enough to attach the bracket. If you buy this mount, make sure the bolts are long enough. Cheetah should supply multiple sizes of bolts to avoid this problem.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Decent TV Wall Mount for Smaller Unit
customer_reviews.text: My 65" tv was a bit much for this mount. I would have gone for larger version if reordering. The only point of concern is the flimsy tilting mechanical (2 allen wrench bolts). The enclosed allen wrench was less than precise and I couldn't keep the tv from tilting forward no matter how tight I wrenched the screws down. I'd stick to nothing larger than a 40" tv. My tv was well within the weight limit on this. I would not buy this again. It has a good range of motion and the tv is secure on the stand.
customer_reviews.author: We are Normal

customer_reviews.title: Great mount, “free” hdmi cable is a joke
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent tv mount with the ability to move tv around for different viewing angles. If you want it to be real close to the wall keep looking there are some that will get closer to the wall however those won’t have the movement that this does. Don’t even bother with the included hdmi cable the end ripped right off and didn’t last a week. As for the mount this is a good product and very strong, also a great value you could buy two of these for the price of one at your local box store.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: The best mounts, hands down!
customer_reviews.text: Cheetah makes the best, most simple mounts hands down!! I have used at least 10 of them so far for myself, family and friends whom i have helped mount TVs. They are simple to install and come with literally everything you need - even including a small level, all the different possible sizes of mounting screws for different TVs, as well as a great high quality HDMI cable that is long enough to go inside the wall. These are fantastic and I recommend them for both first time DIY mounters and seasoned professionals.
customer_reviews.author: JonINY

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe for your TV!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design flaw. The whole product is built very sturdy... except for swivel joint. The swivel joint is plastic, and cheap plastic at that. A few turns and the plastic is withering and crumbling. This makes the rest of the super sturdy metal parts pointless. And puts my wall mounted TV at the risk of falling off the joint.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Re: Good mount
customer_reviews.text: Its a good mount... I mean what can I really say. I wished it angled out a little more but its truly a good mount. UPDATE: The customer service is amazing. They reached out to me to assure my full satisfaction. Cheetah, you offered me a complimentary upgrade for my slight un-satisfaction, I will accept your offer because you are an amazing company, you have an amazing product with superior customer service. Changed from 4 stars to 5 STARS, PS: This shows that superior customer service is just as important if not more important than the product with any business. Thanks Guys!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon BeSharp Images

customer_reviews.title: Great TV Mount but issues with included hardware
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mount once installed. Good range of motion and very sturdy. Deducted one star as we had to purchase additional bolts and washers to mount tv. (It's a Visio, so not and "odd" or uncommon brand.) Several different size Bolts and washers were included with the mounting hardware but the only ones that fit this TV were too short and the heads were too small for any of the included washers. This necessitated a trip to the hardware store for longer bolts an washers that fit.
customer_reviews.author: Roadrunner

customer_reviews.title: Obnoxious rattling
customer_reviews.text: Holds level (with a small shim, no big deal), easy to install, but for the love of god I can't get rid of the most obnoxious buzzing sound any time the volume goes above medium-quiet. I've inserted paper towels between every contact point I could see and made sure everything was tightened, can not get rid of this truly irritating noise. Spend the extra money on something that won't drive you mad any time you watch something other than a period drama.
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate Rain

customer_reviews.title: Nope, nope nope.
customer_reviews.text: I Install TV's as part of my business, and this mount was crap. Came in 2 pieces that had to be assembled, and with the assembly bracket you do not get hardly any slide room to center the TV if your studs are off centered. Older cheetah mounts were great, not sure what happened here. It also does not come with the proper mounting parts, washers missing, the ones it came with did not fit properly and did not have any for the bracket in the back of the TV. Look elsewhere till they figure out their issues.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shimeld

customer_reviews.title: Excellent TV mount bracket
customer_reviews.text: A friend who has mounted numerous TVs on walls for people was impressed with my recent purchase: Cheetah Mounts Dual Articulating Arm TV Wall Mount Bracket. Indeed, installation was quick and easy--with my friend's help of course. My 55" TV fits and moves perfectly on the bracket. The magnetic level and HDMI cord included with the bracket were nice bonuses too. For only $30, this bracket boasts excellent quality for the price, and it turned my living room into a mini-theater. AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: G Willy

customer_reviews.title: Bending under 80 lb television
customer_reviews.text: My 80 pound Sony Bravia seems to be bending it slowly over time it's getting closer and closer to my Xbox I believe the rating was 140 lb television we have only ever pulled it out approximately 8 in at an angle because of our angled wall I'm currently concerned it's somehow going to separate from itself and fall on the floor so for now we haven't completely pushed back not really what we bought it for
customer_reviews.author: La White

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money on something better
customer_reviews.text: First thing was it wasn’t boxed. Living in New England with unpredictable weather boxing is a must. Also anyone can steal something and more likely to if they see what the object is. Upon un boxing which I wish I did a video of.... we had the issue instantly of there not bein enough rubber stoppers.... there’s 2 on one and and only 1 on the other. Disappointed to say the least. However we need the tv up today so we are unable to return and reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Plain wall mount with tilt, and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Added a second 65 inch tv for a security camera system. So we bought the same one as used on the original one... They changed the spring clamp and the newer version is easier to use. It only tilts and does not rotate for side to side, but we knew that and it is good for our application. It nice for a monitor you want close to the wall. And the newer design is wide enough to use straight from the boxwithout the wing for an offset from the wall stud location. The old one had to be assembled to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Big Spud's

customer_reviews.title: Works but has some flaws
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tv mount for my 65" tv. The bolts they give you do t have very wide heads so I had to buy some washers. The holes past two holes are exactly 16" apart which is the distance between each stud. This means you better be precise otherwise you are going to be drilling a few more holes. The extension and rotation arm take a lot of finesse to make it go back to it's original position.i think if the mount was a inch wider on the wall facing side it would make everything much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Weight limitations
customer_reviews.text: This was my second purchase. I was pleased with the mount when I hung a 55" TV on it. The second mount was put in the master bedroom for the same TV while the original mount would hold a 65" TV. The new TV weighs about 62 lbs and the mount claims to hold over 100 lbs. It held but the arms that retract bent under the wight so the TV had quite a tilt. The tilt increased with time creating quite a worry so I replaced the mount with a different design.
customer_reviews.author: Ish

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy washers.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were clear and had nice diagrams. The extras are nice. My only complaint is that i had to buy washers. I needed to use the extension brackets and when i went to screw the mount to my tv, the extension slots were too wide for the screws. So i made a quick trip to the hardware store and picked up some washers and the problem was fixed. But be aware that if you need to use the extension brackets, you will need washers to make it work!
customer_reviews.author: TrishaMayK

customer_reviews.title: Great value at the price paid (~$34), but a little flimsy. And the inclde HDMI cable cannot handle 4K.
customer_reviews.text: Great value at the price paid (~$34), but a little flimsy. I used it to mount a 65" LG 4k TV that weights about 50 lbs. and even though it says the mount can handle TVs weighing over 100 lbs., it seems maxed out with the 50 lb. set. Even with the tilt adjustment set to flat the set is tilted downward at around 10 degrees. The tilt adjustment can really only be set before mounting the set on the wall. And the inclde HDMI cable cannot handle 4K. When playing a 4K Blu-ray, the sound cuts out for a few seconds every couple minutes and the picture drops out every 10-15 minutes. Using a different cable fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: JrSpaceCadet

customer_reviews.title: This was a nice inexpensive mount but the price is inline with other ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice inexpensive mount but the price is inline with other mounts if you know where to buy them. As a hobby, I build and install home theaters. The reason for the three star is that this unit is not a single structural mount. It comes in two parts. The problem with that is you can hang your TV slightly crooked because the two part mount can tweak on you when solidly lag bolted. My 75" Samsung ended up a couple 8ths off. Most people would not notice but because I hang a lot of TV's I noticed it right away. A TV mount should never be two separate parts, especially one to hang large flat panels.....
customer_reviews.author: Scottie W LaCombe

customer_reviews.title: Super fast setup!
customer_reviews.text: This literally took me maybe 30 min at most to set install. The installation instructions were average but easy to understand just by viewing the pictures. Mounting the bracket onto the studs was extremely simple. The brackets used to mount the TV are simple which makes installation a snap. My ONLY suggestion is that the screws for the mounting bracket hook (where you temporarily float/hang the TV by) be made so that one can easily go back and adjust the tilt of the screen easier. Other than that, excellent product at a great price and I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: FL_Prime_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product! 👌🏾👌🏾👌🏾
customer_reviews.text: I did some pretty good research and came across this mount. I read the reviews and most of them were very good. I decided to purchase three of these so that I could mount them throughout our condo. The quality of this product has exceeded expectations. It is made out of high-quality material and extremely sturdy. The packaging is high-quality as well and it comes with everything that you need, even a level. Installation was easy. We simply use a stud finder to find the studs and drove the big screws into the studs to support the mount. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to mount TVs in their home. Definitely 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: BigCope

customer_reviews.title: These are terrific..
customer_reviews.text: These are terrific... and you get a decent HDMI cable in the bargain. (A useless keychain light too, for some utterly unknown reason.) They're easy to assemble, and they stretch to cover both large TVs and wall areas where the studs may be oddly spaced. Once you get the hang of it, it's easy to lift the TV off as well. We haven't survived an earthquake yet, but I'm pretty sure that as long as the beam is standing, this will remain on the wall, and there's a really good chance the TV will remain attached (meaning you can watch coverage of your city collapsing, or something).
customer_reviews.author: Another Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, best mount.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best purchase I have made on Amazon in a long time. The mount itself is stable and well constructed. The weight is balanced and there is no apparent weak point like some Mounts i have used. But you get so much more. A nice HDMI wire, a level, wire straps, a little led flash light. Everything you need to hook up your TV. And that little flash light is great at finding the wire connection points behind the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Klemensowski

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad set but I wouldn't recommend it for the larger sets. The extension is wonky and can throw off your level. My mounting bracket was level but the tv wasn't once hung. Not a huge hldeal but something to be aware of. (65 inch Samsung TV) UPDATE- I am changing my review from 4 stars to 5 just because of how above and beyond the seller went in trying to make things right for me without any asking on my part.
customer_reviews.author: chae white

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!!! Be prepared to fix parts, ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap!!! Be prepared to fix parts, and make adjustments on the fly... It does hold a tv up, but you might want to read all the reviews here and adapt yours... UPDATE 9/5/2018: Horrible company... won't stop calling and calling, they use a RESTRICTED number that you can't block.They refunded my money and shipped me a updated mount that I have now tossed in the trash. I would never buy this again. Not that there is any chance in anything happening but I will be fling a complaint with Amazon, this is unacceptable. Review has been downgraded to 1 star due to this harassment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged and compact. Clear instructions. Solid and sturdy unit that comes with all kinds of extras. Installed super fast and easy. You won't be disappointed! The best part for me was, because of the design of the pin that holds the TV to the arm, I was able to safely install without the assistance of another person! Just hoist the TV up and put it on the pin/bolt and you can then use both hands to secure the various washers and wingnut. Boom - done!
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome articulating display mount
customer_reviews.text: Mounted a new 50" 4k Samsung to this display. All the hardware was included- all you need is a stud finder, pencil, drill, and torque wrench. This is a strong, adjustable, and simple design. No frills, no fuss. The quality braided hdmi cable and (CHEAP) level are an added bonus. This is a very simple and easy display mounting option. The materials and build are of the product are of superior quality. They should charge more for what you're getting. If you mount this to just drywall, the frame itself would probably rip right out before you even get a display on it. It's heavy duty. Just mount it to studs.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for Samsung 60" 4K UHD
customer_reviews.text: Installation is straightforward I was able to install and mount my 60" Samsung by myself without issue. I had no issues with the screen tilting down to far. The two long bottom screws set my angle and the four side screws locked it in. The HDMI cable that came with the mount did not work the cable caused HDCP issues. I had to use another HDMI cable. That being said I didn't by this for the cable and the mount works great articulates smoothly and feels strong. My Samsung is rated at 51.8lbs which is well under the maximum rating of this mount at 45% of rated load maximum. I would purchase again at this price point for the mount.
customer_reviews.author: Jrjeeping

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I only give this a 4 star because it doesn't come very far off the wall. This may be awesome to some people but I don't have room to hook my cords up. If you want things hooked up I suggest doing it before you mount it. Great quality though. **UPDATE** The company contacted me and offered a partial refund due to my experience with the bracket being so close to the wall. Their customer service is SUPERB! I would recommend them solely for their customer service because they stand behind their products. They want you, their customer, to be satisfied. I do prefer the wall mount that swivels and bought 2 of those as well which work amazingly!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra VanHorn

customer_reviews.title: Full Motion? Not easily.
customer_reviews.text: The mount comes packaged well and is fairly easy to install with 2 people. There are screws to tighten for the tilt, which has held up for a few months. As far as full motion, this thing does NOT move easily. Articulation and swivel take a lot of strength. I mounted this thinking it would easily swivel out and go back against the wall when I wanted it to. It doesn’t. My wife can’t get it to move, and I’ve got to use way more force than really comfortable using against a tv (so have to reach behind to the arm. I’m 6’1” 220lbs and an athlete. Don’t get this expecting it to move regularly.
customer_reviews.author: M. French

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install - flexible mounting options - Depending on your TV might want to buy a screw kit.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mounting system. If your connections are out the side of the TV and not on the back of the TV. This makes your TV (43 inch LED samsung in my case) sit very close to the wall Flexible in mounting options to accomodate for studs. The kit came with proper screws bolts, hdmi cable, screen cleaning cloth, and velcro, for 19 bucks. This is a great mount. Depending on your TV you might want to get an additional screw kit, The options for M6 and m8 lengths is limited that come with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jas

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and many choices of position.
customer_reviews.text: Very simple installation. My house has 16 inch on center studs and within 30 minutes I had sunk the four provided lag bolts dead center into studs and had the mount firmly fixed to the wall. My TV is a Samsung 55 inch so I recruited a friend to help me place it up on the mount to avoid unnecessary jockeying of the set over my head. My friend and I were able to place the TV on the mount in under a minute. Closer to 20 seconds. Highly recommended, great price.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Updated Now Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Updated: new mount arrived quickly. Awesome product and exceptional customer service. Got in touch with customer service for seller - they were awesome and are sending me new mount. Based on customer service alone, I would buy again as I own other Cheetah mounts and this was first time I had an issue. Definitely a 5 star! The ball head which attaches to TV and used for tilt position already broke and it was only holding a super lightweight 32” tv. Hopefully manufacturer will see this and contact me to resolve since it was only purchased in Aug, 2019.
customer_reviews.author: MaaaaQ

customer_reviews.title: Best TV mount that I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: After buying several TV mounts in the past, this mount is by far the best I have ever bought. It was super easy to install and it mounts close to the wall but still gives a nice range of tilt. If you don’t need a mount that swivels side to side, get this one, you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Economical multi purpose mount for variety of tv sizes
customer_reviews.text: It’s very economical multi purpose mount for variety of tv sizes. Shipping was quick. Areas where supplier can improve: 1. Use light color packing plastic and shipping so that it’s easy to get handle on various parts and small screws. All black packaging makes it very hard to hunt for right parts and follow instructions. 2. I would prefer a one piece frame bar rather than joint in between for larger TV. Joint in middle limit the lateral adjustment flexibility of the TV due to hindering screws. It also limits the choice of wholes for mounting to stud. Overall I like it and may buy it again for small tv 55 or lower but for higher sizes do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NewarkFarmer

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good quality and plenty of different articulations!
customer_reviews.text: The product is exactly as advertised with one notable exception! The directions are below average. The directions are pictures with no text to guide you through some important steps. Other than that the kit contains everything you need. You have a drywall screw option and different size screws depending on the type of tv you have. Tools: a drill 4.8MM bit is a must, flat head and phillips screw drivers and a socket wrench #13.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: as advertised good product
customer_reviews.text: i ordered 2 of them they are great for new light TVs, i have an older 65inch plasma that close to 120lbs, yea i will not hang it on these though. but good product . i will continue to add that there customer service is awesome, they reached out to me gave me a discount and offered me a larger wall mount. i was not expecting any of this nor did i ask for it. i will continue to buy from them for my wall mounted Tvs. i have a friend that is about to buy a house and will need 3-4 mounts and i will be getting them from this dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat this mount for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a great mount - this is at least the 5th one I have purchased for home and work. The price for the sturdiness is amazing - it's easy to mount to the wall, it's easy to hang the TV on it, it's low profile but still provides enough space for your to sneak your hand in the back to fumble with a cable if need be without dismounting your TV. Did I mention the price is amazing for the quality!!!! It now comes with a HDMI cable too... a nice braided one that could leave welts on someone if you whacked them with it...nice addition to the box!
customer_reviews.author: CLTGUY

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The mount is sturdy and works well. Just make sure to install it to studs in the wall. Drywall wont hold the weight of most tvs. The leveling tool is a nice bonus to have. And is great to keep for any other projects. The hdmi cable is also a cute bonus. Chances are you may already have all you need already, but if you don't, the supplied one definately works. Ive purchased this mount twice now. I love the price, and I enjoy how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE THIS FOR LARGER TV'S!
customer_reviews.text: This claims to support up to 49", 66lb TV's. Well, my 40", 49lb TV just about dropped off the wall and snapped the thing in two. Luckily I was standing right by it as it was making ominous popping/snapping noises, so I was able to save the TV, but I'm returning this immediately (and I'm now without a TV until a better mount arrives. I'm sure it would have worked great for a smaller, lighter TV. Also, if your TV has its inputs/outputs centered between the mounting holes, the plate will block them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon O'Very

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price but solid product. Can't go wrong with price. Don't be nervous that you're getting a bad product because of the price--it's solid. Easy to install. Clearance/tilt behind the TV (even with spacers) is small. Have a hard time plugging in my firestick (to outlet behind tv) because it protrudes too much for the clearance space. Attachments isn't as solid/tight as a higher priced mount, however at no time did I worry about its stability to hold the TV. Sure, you can find a better, more expensive mount. However, if your just looking for a simple tilt mount with no concerns for clearance---look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Our Go-To TV Mount from Now On
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to mount a 60" HDTV on our walls. I was surprised by how small the mounting materials were, based on my experience with other wall mounts. However, installation was very easy and was accomplished with just my wife and I (and a bit of patience). In the few years that we've owned the mount, we haven't had to remove the TV from the wall, so I haven't had the joy of trying that out. The free HDMI cable that came with the mount has also come in handy, and we appreciated that bonus item. We will certainly be buying this same wall mount in the future.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't be recommended for large TVs
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my order with the 75" TV purchase because it was a recommended add-on. First, you have to add the extension brackets to make it wide enough for a large TV. That was okay but would have preferred a single solid unit, messing around with tiny bolts to piece it together was not what I had in mind. Second, unlike most other TV mounts I've bought it only has 3 sets of mounting bolts, none of which are long enough for the mounting holes on the TV it was recommended with. In the trash it goes and off to find another bracket. Bad recommendation Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Laird

customer_reviews.title: Great item and excellent service. but missing screws to my 65 inch  Samsung TV
customer_reviews.text: This mount is nice for the price. I can confirm it is durable, strong and has a good build. My tv: Samsung 65 inch TV Mount of drywall with staud Used a 3/8 " (0.95mm) drill bit Tools on the item for balancing The only bad thing is that new bigger TVs need bigger screws. You can find them in home Depot but you still have to go out. The seller told there will be new model with new screws, but in the meantime they refund me enough to pay the cost of the screws and trip to the store. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo López

customer_reviews.title: Great...if you get the correct parts.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these mounts multiple times and never had any problem. These new versions come pre-assembled which is great except.... after spending 30minutes confirming i wasn't crazy i realized one of the TV brackets "hooks" were a slightly different length than the other. This made the TV slant when mounted on the wall bracket no matter what, and is completely unusable. If i wasn't in a time crunch i would have returned it. I ended up using the "TV Brackets/Hooks" from a different mount i had lying around, luckily it fit. Not sure how i ended up with two different size hooks but huge inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: JBS

customer_reviews.title: Good...but with adjustments, could be great
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Cheetah mount for 6 TVs so i've become pretty well versed in it. The material seems sturdy and once you have it into studs, you get the sense that nothing is moving for a very long time. The one problem i have with it is why would you make it so that the extension piece doesnt fit 16" OC studs...it is soooo frustrating. All you have to do it would seems would be to cut the holes different and it would allow you so much more versatility as far as mounting position goes. As it stands, the 16" OC setup allows maybe 2 inches of adjustment left or right. Give us some more versatility!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price,  but ....
customer_reviews.text: This mount is ok for the cheap price but I'd recommend investing in one a little better. It seems sturdy as I was worried that it would not hold my tv. My biggest issue is that I cannot use the ports on the back of my TV because there is very little room between the wall and TV. I'm now looking to replace this one for one that extends out. Dont expect much with the level, it completely fell apart while trying to level the TV. Hope this review helps with your decision
customer_reviews.author: SR34

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend This
customer_reviews.text: I install a lot of TV’s in peoples homes and I’ve gotten away from suggesting that they but anything other then this. It gives you full tilt and side to side options. You can turn towards or away from you depending on your need. If you have to access the wall to plug or unplug connected devices, this is the best product to have. It accommodates bigger TV’s as well as some mid size devices. I always try to hit a stud but I toggle bolts a lot of my installs as well. Some people’s homes are older and the stud done align as I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine

customer_reviews.title: Very secure
customer_reviews.text: Securely holds your TV, but if you are using a tv larger than 32” it won’t tilt much. Originally posted the above review and headline with a 4 star star rating. The company (SPN Performance) has repeatedly contacted me demanding that I rate their product 5 stars. They’ve harassed me by sending well over 20 emails since I purchased this product and won’t leave me alone. They simply won’t accept a less than 5 star rating and seek to be willing to go to extreme lengths to make that happen. I’d suggest you purchase a tv mount from another source simply to avoid this company entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Unruh

customer_reviews.title: mounting can be a problem with off set to  studs,
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but add a plate tomount on or extension bar or angle to make 3 studs for 65" & larger .. a little floppy but 12ga or better material base with short angles.. nice to have? a bar or plate to bolt to this unit to extend reach to a 3rd stud or either side... would firm up install I had it welded to an existing mount that was not a swivel. Bad selection on my part. Overall works well would re buy with potential extension piece.
customer_reviews.author: sid B.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, 70"
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my 70" sharp tv. Install was really simple, had to use the extensions of course but no complaints with the mount. The level is kind of useless as they use blue die which makes it really hard to see the black lines but I just used my own anyways. Would definately buy again.
customer_reviews.author: A Monkeys Uncle

customer_reviews.title: Great mount at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: After searching for a reasonably priced fully articulating single stud mount, I finally found this one. I needed to mount a 43" TV in portrait orientation to use as a digital movie poster, and this worked perfectly. Installation was quick and easy. I will point out that if you want this perfectly centered somewhere, you need to account for a 0.75" vertical offset where the mounting plate attaches to the arm. Shipping was also ridiculously quick for me. I ordered late Saturday afternoon, and it was delivered around 1:00pm on Sunday! I had it mounted that night and couldn't be happier. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: GWCR

customer_reviews.title: Check placement of studs
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but we had to build a brace to center it over the fireplace. Stud over fireplace is in center, and the brackets are not long enough to center over fireplace. The company contacted med regarding my concerns and were very responsive. Could have returned it and gotten a support that had larger wall mounts, but it was easily adapted to fit over the fireplace with 2-1x1/2 wooden mounts. It is very sturdy and allows extension and swiveling for us to watch while lying on couch or on the other side of the room in our workout equipment. Would buy from this company again, but would check the stud placement in my wall.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Rush

customer_reviews.title: I buy on Amazon constantly. My buying criteria tends ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy on Amazon constantly. My buying criteria tends to be two things; prime and 4 star or higher reviews with a significant number of reviews. Since this is my preferred method of shopping, I know how valuable reviews can be and I try to do them frequently. Occasionally I will ask my husband what he thought about a particular item I purchased. He doesn't often have much to say..."it's good". This mount was the first thing I've bought where, after he installed it, he said, "when you rate that TV mount, 5 stars". I'd say that's high praise!
customer_reviews.author: JessicaK

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying mounts from this company for many years. So long in fact, that the product has changed a bit over time. This product change (same model number) meant that my 2012 65 inch plasma tv no longer would fit on the wall bracket, as the mounting points are extremely wide (way wider than any of today's standards). I contacted customer support, as it worked on the previous mount from 2012 and they happily helped me out by sending me a few extra parts so that I could extend the mount to make it work for my application (at no extra cost). Great products, great customer service, great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Q

customer_reviews.title: Cheetah Mounts Flush Wall TV Mount - Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Mount arrived as described an undamaged. Instructions were a little confusing at first, then I realized I couldn't read Spanish fluently and just looked at the pictures. The anchors supplied seemed flimsy, so I used my own. I'm sure they would be fine for a 20-32" TV, but I didn't want to trust my new 48" 4k to something I wasn't 100% sure of; just my personal preference. Overall a well built mount when constructed, and no doubt about the TV being secured t the wall. Highly recommend a recessed outlet/data connection combo outlet if your mount will cover the outlet/inputs since this is close to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Kudos to the inventor
customer_reviews.text: Who ever invented this mount had their thinking cap on. The mount has so many different holes and slots it should accommodate most any TV. Unless your television weighs over 50 lbs it should be fine, IF YOU GET THE MAIN HORIZONTAL PIECE MOUNTED DIRECTLY TO A WALL STUD WITH SOME 3" OR LARGER LAG SCREWS. I WOULD NOT MOUNT ANY TV TO JUST SHEETROCK OR METAL STUDS FOUND IN MANY NEW HOUSES AND BUILDINGS!! This is a very cool mount. It is slightly adjustable if you want the TV at an angle. If you are unsure you have the main support bracket mounted securely, please call a professional. A really nice piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: olenglish

customer_reviews.title: Find a stud!
customer_reviews.text: Nice Unit! For under $20 it's great. It's strong enough. Hung my 40" MU6300 on it and it's fine. I pretty much hang my body weight on any mount to check its strength, It's all about the fastening. Find a stud, do not use wall anchors, find a stud. Concrete wall- use a good expanding anchor with a quality lag bolt, dont use red heads, or tapcons. Make sure to tighten all hardware before setting the TV on it. Sweet HDMI cable also.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T.

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to scrub your hands all day after handling this mount.
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: The mount seems to be well constructed and I assume is durable. Con's: This is by far the heaviest wall mount I've used. This may be a con if you are using drywall anchors/toggle bolts instead of mounting into your studs. The brackets that attach onto your TV lack a quick release. The main reason for the 2 star rating is because my mount came with a sticky substance all over it. It had the consistency of tree sap and is very hard to scrub out of your hands.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Good value, Great service
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s a decent wall mount. Cheap feeling but you get what you pay for. Didn’t come with the right screws for my tv so had to buy some other screws. I’m still using the wall mount so it’s durable. UPDATED REVIEW: I added an extra 1 star because their customer service is great. I left a 4 star review prior and I wasn’t really complaining, but the seller contacted me and provided me an upgraded model for me to try. Wow...I wasn’t expecting for them to contact me. Great customer service, upgraded model works great. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: HUNG B

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Plenty strong, easy to use. I have bought 2 of these. I had to cut the ears off on each because of the shape of the back of the 32" tv's, would not seat flat to the tv otherwise. The long HDMI cord that comes with it is nice too. But the cord was bad in the second package, I have a few laying around so no sweat. If not for the bad cord I would have given 5 stars, I don't blame them for the shape of the back of my tv's.
customer_reviews.author: #1shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works for the Vizio E43-C2 43"
customer_reviews.text: I have a Vizio e43-c2 (43") that I used this mounting bracket with. After looking up the VESA mm for this model tv (which is 200mm x 200mm), I didn't think this was the correct mount because the instructions don't list it but it fits and the included M6 screws work with this television for the bracket, so you're good. I affixed the magnets to the release paws and can't get them to stick to the metal brackets for whatever reason. My only issue is I wish the tilt things on the brackets had some sort of click feel so I could match both sides up to the same degree of tilt instead of eye balling it.
customer_reviews.author: LovinLife

customer_reviews.title: Great Option
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy and tilt-adjustable mount perfect for our 55". We've used other types of TV mounts before, but the instructions for this model was easiest to follow. All pieces needed to assemble and install were included. I would recommend this to anyone. One thing to note: the gap between the back of the TV and the wall was a bit larger anticipated. We did read the clearance space on the product description, but it did not seem like it would be as pronounced when holding a tape measure to the wall before purchasing. For anyone looking for the most narrow profile may want to look for another option, but will likely not find anything that tilts.
customer_reviews.author: RAD Resort

customer_reviews.title: Broke my tv screen and no one will answer for it
customer_reviews.text: This mount came pre assembled . Everything was good , made sure we mounted it professionally on studs and everything was fine until the are that pulls out cause the tv to come out , had the screw fall out in front of my and I heard it drop about 4 inches. I saw my brand new lg 4K tv crack and I put it back on the tightened everything but the tv is gone and no one will answer me so I am contacting my attorney. product_meta.title: Cheetah Mounts Dual Articulating Arm TV Wall Mount Bracket for 20-65” TVs up to VESA 400 and 115lbs, Mounts on Studs up to 16” and Includes a Twisted Veins 10’ HDMI Cable & 6” 3-Axis Magnetic Bubble
product_meta.description:
Size:VESA 400 Dual ArmFits TVs up to VESA 400 (NOT VESA 600)

This mount fits TVs up to VESA 400. Most TVs 65” and smaller use VESA 400 or smaller. But some TVs 65” and smaller use VESA 600. This mount will Not fit VESA 600 even if the TV is 65” or less. If your TV has a VESA 600 hole pattern, we suggest the APDAM2B.

Fits 16” Studs (NOT 20” or 24”)

The wall plate for this mount is 17” and will fit 16” wall studs. Once mounted on two 16” wall studs, the TV will be centered between the two studs. No side to side adjustment is possible. If your walls have 20” or 24” studs, this mount will not fit. For 24” studs, we suggest the APDAM2B.

TV Screws

Many TVs require no screws because they use the same screws from the TV stand. This mount ships with one set each of 4mm, 5mm, 6mm and 8mm TV screws. It also includes spaces to adjust for screw length. These screws support most TVs but Not All TVs. If your TV requires different screws, Cheetah Mounts stocks hundreds of TV screw sets at their US warehouse which they will ship for free.

TV Leveling

If you mount the wall plate level on the wall, the TV plate may still not be level. To correct for this, there are four screws where the arms attach to the TV plate. If you loosen these screws you can rotate the TV plate to level it. The amount of rotation adjustment required can vary as the arms are extended.

14" Extension, Low 2.7" Profile, 130° Swivel, ±20° Tilt, ±3° Rotation Adjustment

The articulating arm extends up to 14" from the wall yet collapses to 2.7". The mount allows for up to 130° swivel, ±20° tilt and ±3° of rotational adjustment. The amount of swivel is limited on larger TVs as the edge of the TV hits the wall.

10' Twisted Veins HDMI Cable and 6" Magnetic Bubble Level

The mount includes a 10’ Twisted Veins High Speed with Ethernet HDMI cable featuring 4K 60HZ HDR signal support and a protective braided jacket.

This mount ships with Four sets of TV mounting screws and spacers to fit most TVs. But it does Not have screws for All TVs. However, if your TV requires different screws, Cheetah stocks hundreds of TV screw sets in the US and will ship any required screws for free.
